turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Elaine Tarone.
turn.2: Elaine Tarone Elaine Tarone is a retired professor of linguistics and is a distinguished teaching professor emerita at the University of Minnesota.
turn.4: Tarone was born in Modesto, California and graduated from Thomas Downey High School in 1962.
turn.5: Where did Tarone go to college?
turn.6: She spent her freshman year at Modesto Junior College and in 1966 earned a B.A. from the University of California, Berkeley.
turn.8: After a summer volunteering in a street academy in Harlem, New York, she earned a secondary teaching credential at UC Berkeley.
turn.9: What did she do after college?
turn.10: She taught English and Spanish for a year at Encinal High School in Alameda, California, and in 1969 earned a diploma in applied linguistics at the Department of Applied Linguistics at Edinburgh University.
turn.11: Did she graduate with any other degrees?
turn.12: Transferring to the University of Washington, Seattle, she earned an M.A. (1970) and Ph.D. (1972) in speech science, writing a dissertation on her research on intonation in African-American vernacular English.
